comment: She was very lenient with the opportunities to earn back points. She applies your work to real world situations which is always helpful in understanding something. Mostly discussions and textbook work. 2 tests and one big project. The project isn't hard at all, it is just time consuming and fun.

I'm taking her class online and while there is a schedule it seems very low effort and unorganized. While she is a nice person she is not willing to work with you in any way to help your grade. Our semester long project is a segmented assignment and because I missed a 25/1000 point assignment I miss out on the remaining 250 points. I had a High B

If you can take a hybrid class you should. I did 66% in person 33% online so I only had to go twice a week instead of three times, and we had a little bit more homework but it was all easy. Weekly quizzes are hard but don't weigh much (I failed plenty and got an A), discussion posts are super easy and weigh 35%. Scheier is super sweet and helpful.

I really respected Dr. Scheier and the way she taught. This is not an easy class per se, but it is broken down into manageable chunks. The research paper is not hard to do as long as you keep up. Overall, great professor and good class.

She was very nice but wouldn't say she's a great teacher. I didn't learn from her but from her PowerPoints and lectures that we had to look at online on our own time. There is some assignments each week that aren't bad but there's a quiz every single Monday in class. She does attendance so you have to go to class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Just seemed very unorganized and all tests were lockdown browser with webcam. Discussions and quizzes each week but it's not anything difficult. The whole class material is just common sense stuff. Also has a 14 day project which wasn't difficult

She was on okay prof, wouldn't take her class again, though. Her online course was very unorganized and you could tell her emails and announcements were copied and pasted from summer courses, so deadlines were never clear. 14 consecutive day project with graph. Discussions and quizzes due every week. Only a midterm and final. Did love the textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: SO AWFUL. There is so much due every week it is exhausting. 3-4 quizzes on Achieve (Textbook), discussion, and LOCKDOWN W/ CAMERA weekly. SO annoying. You are actually graded on your discussions and if she feels that you participated enough in hitting the word count. I would never take this professor again.

I'm not sure about in person but online this professor is not one I'd recommend. There is very little guidance as to what any of the quizzes or midterms will be on. She doesn't let you see what you got wrong on quizzes and refused to give study guides. Hank green basically taught this class. Find a different Professor

VERY UNREASONABLE. You do not get ANY skips, ANY drops on the lowest grade, you only get ONE favor and she does NOT care. Half of the time I sent emails she just did not respond accurately. Insane amounts of work to do per week, 1 hour+ lecture, tons of achieve activities, an achieve quiz, and lockdowns. would not even bump 1% on a class I passed!

Caring and sweet professor. The lectures can be boring, but they're very informative. No study guides for the quizzes and there is a lot of material for a short and quite difficult quiz. Take a lot of notes and read the book, and you'll be okay. A lot of grades are put in, allowing you to bomb many quizzes and still pass. Would take it again.

Professor Scheier is funny for sure. Attendence is MANDATORY you get 2 absences before she starts deducting points. The homework is hefty some days and light on others, lectures don't really contribute much to tests, only quizzes. Textbook is your best friend of you want good grades.

Lectures are mandatory, with a 3 absents being the limit. Dr. Schier is eccentric, but enjoyable and she has lots of work to pad your grade out. She says herself people can fail exams and still pass. She also gives tons of extra credit. Note: her tests and quizzes are based off both the textbook and lecture, so you'll have to read lots!
She is very sweet and cares a lot about her students.

Great professor for a basic class. Lots of reading but test questions are pretty simple and filling out study guides help a lot. 4 tests that are all Webcam with Lockdown Browser, but would take again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Scheier is an amazing professor and truly wants students to learn and get good grades. She is always very clear about what she is expecting from assignments and gives many opportunities for extra credit. She made this difficult class very easy to follow! She's very understanding and awesome I definitely recommend taking her!!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Class is enjoyable if you like the subject but annoying. Extremely long chapters and the weekly quizzes + exam are all proctored. Sometimes the textbook doesnt help with the quizzes at all. Discussions every week as well but theyre pretty easy. Overall, Sandra is very nice and always gives weekly updates about what is due.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This professor was very fair and overall a good professor. Gave a couple of HW assignments, a quiz, and a discussion post every week, and that was about it. Very easy to listen to and has a great personality when lecturing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She was truly an alright professor but her lectures were very boring, especially considering all the course material was online. She was also very picky about attendance when again, all the material, activities, and quizzes were online. A lot of unnecessary Achieve Activities but the work is very easy.
Professor Scheier is very nice, but her quizzes are difficult and they are lockdown browser.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Partially okay at giving feedback (if you ask for questions, you got wrong in a proctored quiz, she gives you the topic, not the specific question), her quizzes don't match the material. Also, lockdown browser with webcam if you take her online. The class is also very homework heavy, but not difficult at all.

The Good: She is really nice and caring. Lots of opportunity for points. Do all the discussions and HW. 
The Bad: Her lectures are extremely boring, just reads the PowerPoint word for word with very little input of her own. Also only 2 tests, each over 8 chapters Granted the tests are only worth a combined 120 out of 1000. Quizzes ARE now proctored
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: You will have a quiz and a discussion due each week. The discussions are easy but can be quite tedious, and as for the quizzes (not lockdown) the answers are on quizlet. Midterm and final are lockdown browser but only worth 10% of the grade. If your here for the credit then go for it cause its an easy A, otherwise dont expect to learn anything.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: This class is really not bad. A quiz and discussion are due each Sunday plus a midterm and final (midterm and final are taken on lockdown). I got As on almost all the quizzes and 100s on the discussions but bombed the midterm and final and still got an A. Take this class.
I took an online class. She is an average professor, and her lectures are very boring. She isn't using the technologies ideally, and some of her video lessons contain so much background noise.
Easy A, just do the assignments and get some help with Quizlets and flash cards, youll have an Easy A no prob
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: This teacher is great for an easy A! She is terrible at responding to emails although she's really easy like every week's assignment is to just do a discussion post and her tests and quizzes are all not lockdown browser so it's pretty self-explanatory.

Took the asynchronous class and definitely one of my easiest classes. Each Sunday there is a quiz and discussion post due but they're extremely easy. You can take the quiz multiple times to reach a good grade. Discussion posts are common sense and don't really require much info from the book. Never had to really speak to her and have a 99% so far!

Super easy and fun class! Learned a lot. Had to read a chapter each week and take a quiz and do a discussion post. Never even talked with the Professor except twice over email and seemed super sweet. No test except the final at the end and a Stress project. This class was so beneficial for real life and super easy. Would take this class again 100%
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: great choice for an online summer class. she gives good feedback and grades things very fast. we used the textbook but she provided a pdf of each chapter so we didn't even have to buy it. quizzes are easy and straightforward

I enjoyed this class. Wednesday are discussion posts, then Fri/Sat/Sun is a quiz and discussion replies, pretty standard stuff. There is a semester-long project that requires three outlines, then a final paper. You have to do some research on APA outline procedures, but she's gentle with the grading (worth only a couple of points).

I took her online class and it is super easy! We have discussions every week that are easy and interesting, also a midterm and final on lockdown browser . You will have a project that's fun to do as well, this class really isn't hard at all. All our quizzes are on mind tap! She will be sure to tell u how much she hates cheating. Over all easy A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She is a really nice person overall and gives good lectures. I had her hybrid class so lectures were once a week and there was a super in-depth discussion post which she offered extra credit for. All tests are online with lockdown/webcam browser and only 25 mins to complete a 30 question test so it was really difficult to finish in time.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Nothing special, just do the weekly assignments. Offers a lot of extra credit. Tests can be a little difficult.

She makes this class unnecessarily hard. Discussions each week which have to be extremely long to get credit, plus 4 tests where she barely gives you enough time so you have to make sure you know every little thing beforehand otherwise you won't finish. She's obsessed with cheating and will send out 100 emails about it. She stressed me out so much

Her class is super easy, it consists of weekly discussions, that require a lot of writing, tests, and sona credits. If you do a discussion before a certain time, you get a bonus of 4 pts. The answers to all tests can be found on quizlet, you should have plenty of time to look up all the answers. Sona credits come from easy questionnaires

Easy A. I took this as a hybrid. Offers extra credit opportunities. She told us we needed the textbook, but I barely used it. Everything you need to know is on the power points she posts for each chapter. I only learned some material because there is a discussion post every week. Besides that, tests are online.
Average professor, very nice, but also very busy. She reads straight off the powerpoint.
rating_tags: LECTURE HEAVY--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Get ready to read

comment: Easy and didnt require much effort. Tou take a quiz and have a discussion to post each week. With it being an online class you can really use your resources and do well without a whole lot of studying. I dedicated less than an hour each week to this class and got a 95.
Super easy professor. Online exams where every answer is on quizlet. Have to complete weekly discussion posts and have to complete 2 online surveys. Easy class.
Lectures are very boring but the class is easy itself.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took a hybrid for this class. 4 online exams, weekly discussion posts, and a required SONA research project that is super easy. If you want an easy A then this is the professor to take but you won't really take away any knowledge from the class. She's really nice and encourages participation in lectures.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I took this class online and liked her. She was very clear about assignments. Basically just a discussion post and quiz every week, a midterm and final. You had to participate in some surveys for research but it was super easy and not due til the end of the semester. I used the powerpoints for quizzes and tests, never even opened my book.

I took the Hybrid class. It in an EASY A. All tests and class material are online. She is a huge disappointment as a professor though. She reads straight from the powerpoint, and doesn't seem like she wants to be there. It's a huge waste to go to class. Just do it all online and you will get an A. Didn't take a lot away from this class.
This class is so so easy!! Take this professor if you can! All tests and quizzes and tests are online, so it is so easy. The work does not take long to do at all. EASY A!!

Hybrid is Easy A. Went to class 3 times. Such a waste to attend. Every powerpoint is on D2L, so were weekly discussions and exams.  In class, she simply read off ppt's. Huge disappointment, being that I loved psych in high school and looked forward to another great course. Prepare to teach yourself everything and Google will be your best friend.

4 tests online (answers on quizlet) Very straightforward discussion post with a reply every week, just put some effort into them, if you reply in the first week she'll add an extra 4 points to the grade. SUPER easy class, not mandatory but does take attendance because if you miss less than 2 classes she'll add points to your grade at the end.

shes so sweet and i her tests are all straight forward. i took this as a hybrid course and every week were given dicussions to complete and we have two weeks. if posted by first week you get +4 points. shes so great!!!! take her!!! easy a!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: You have 2 chapters to read every week in addition to online content.  Tests are hard and discussions are tedious and overwhelming.  I would not recommend this teacher.

Loooong online lectures.  If you don't want to watch videos all day long and take detailed notes, don't even think about taking this class.  I had 40 pages of notes for first test and got a low B.  Stay away.
Wow.  This class has an unreasonable about of online videos to watch daily.  Just don't take this professor.  You will regrett it.

Tons of homeowrk and really tough tests.  If you don't listen to every second of the long lectures online, you will never pass the tests.  It is much more difficult class than previously.  It has changed, believe me.  You GPA will suffer.   I spent 3 hours a day listening to lectures and taking notes.

Assume and EASY teacher!! take if possible. Discussions each week (14 of them) open for 2 weeks; if done in the first week(4 its extra credit would be added to grade). respond to one person. 4 tests all easy( answers on quizlet). EVERYTHING IS ONLINE!!!!! EASY A!!!

Prof. Scheier is a sweet teacher. Always let's you know when stuff is do, and what to expect. Lectures feel long, but she does her best to make them interesting. Discussion/reply every week, and not something you can do last minute. Tests aren't too bad and they're online. Reading the book doesn't help you with a fair amount of them. Gives EC too.

She's a nice person. She talks the whole class & takes attendance. There is a discussion every single week where you have to write a few paragraphs and respond to another students discussion for full credit. She grades the discussions hard to so they aren't something you can do last minute. Tests are online & super easy. Have to put effort for an A

AI took the hybrid version of this class. Attendance is mandatory but all she does is skim through powerpoints that she provides for you. Tests are online and easy and just lots of discussion posts but is generous with extra credit points. Easy A
She is very sweet and wants everyone to do well! Study for all the tests and do the online discussions and you'll make an A/B.

I took a hybrid class PSYC 1101. The class is easy and she makes it even easier because of her grading system. Prepare for test and do the online discussions and get an A or high B. Honestly, she kind of just sounds like she's winging it 95% of the time. I'm sure she knows what she's talking about, but she has trouble showing it. Good Powerpoints.
